comments.author: Josué Alpizar

comments.text:
As someone who was seriously hyped for this movie, eagerly awaiting some 
kind of announcement, the initial trailer recently pushed me away. Pretty 
harshly too. Then I had revelations how DC just kind of abandons a lot of 
its fans. Most humans liked TDK trilogy. But no, since Marvel is now a 
threat, DC just has to start from the ground up so it can unite all of its 
heroes. This is not a bad thing at all, but that Batman has to start 
over... again! Why not just use the Nolan one that everyone loves? Why 
raise fan controversy with Ben Affleck? I don't hate the guy, but most 
people do. So why choose him? Also, why not give each hero a movie? Why 
throw them all into one movie with little to no development? Why stylize 
the entire movie now, Snyder? Man of Steel tried so hard to make earth 
believable and realistic, but now it looks like Halloween Town. Sharp 
angles, odd colors, and I can't see shit. Is Batman's armor really 
kryptonite? That's retarded! Why can't it be a legit battle where Superman 
wins instantly? Why do Batman fantards always give him the stupid penalty 
of "If he had enough prep time, he could beat anybody!" If hanyone had 
"enough prep time" they would win, and it is not a real fight! Why can't 
Superman just lazer-eye Batman's mouth area? Why is Wonder Woman here to 
add to the fuster cluck? Why is the Joker such a miserable design? Snyder's 
messing up everything, but he's proud of it! *LOOK HOW HAPPY HE IS* 
http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/3/33/Zack_Snyder.jpg﻿

comments.author: Uncle Devin (Honorablefool)

comments.text:
+Nate Patterson I like the light and humor tone of the Marvel Cinematic 
Universe and I usually don't like dark movies but I think DC is wise to go 
that route. Marvel and DC's tones should be distinctively different from 
each other. As much as I love the Marvel Cinematic Universe, I want DC's 
Cinematic Universe to succeed. Before watching the MCU the only Marvel 
character I was familiar with was Spider-Man, But I knew DC's characters 
well. I am one who had some MINOR nitpicky complaints about Man of Steel 
but Overall it was the best Superman movie I have ever seen

comments.text:
+MotionTransformer DC is in too deep with the whole dark and brooding movie 
format to change it now. If they change their style now to match Marvel's, 
then they're not only admitting defeat against Marvel studios but will also 
get accused of copycatting Marvel as a cash grab. So basically DC can stick 
to their guns or follow Marvel's lead but it'll still be a lose/lose 
situation in the end.
